results.title: Codine
results.brief_description:
Codine has just finished a ten year sentence for murder and heads back to a Bucharest slum to be reunited with his mother, whose penny-pinching ways infuriate her son. Adrien, a young boy, befriends Codine and through his eyes discovers social injustice and the world of adults. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1963: Best screenplay for Henri Colpi, Yves Jamiaque and Dimitriu Carabat.

Credits: Producer, Emile Breysse ; director, Henri Colpi ; writers, Henri Colpi, Yves Jamiaque, Dimitriu Carabat ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Theodor Grigoriu.
Cast: Alexandru Platon, Nelly Borgeaud, Razvan Petresco, Francoise Brion, Maurice Sarfati, Nelly Borgeaud.

results.title: Cherchez L'idole = Look for the Idol
results.brief_description:
A young man is pushed into a dare by a girlfriend and has to steal a piece of jewellery. Interrupted in the act by nosy neighbors, he must abandon the gems in a guitar at a music shop. When he returns later to get hold of the jewels, the guitar has been sold. Musical performances by the ‘pop idols’ of the era: Charles Aznavour, Nancy Holloway, Johnny Hallyday, Sylvie Vartan and Frank Alamo.

Credits: Producer, Mario Chabert ; director, Michel Boisrond ; writers, Annette Wademant, Michel Balducci ; photography, Raymond Lemoigne ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Frank Fernandel, Berthe Granval, Dany Saval, Mylene Demongeot, Johnny Halliday.

results.title: Dis-Moi Que Tu M'aimes = Tell Me You Love Me
results.creator_credit: Michel Boisrond, Francis Cosne and Gerard Beytout
results.brief_description:
Bertrand and Richard both work in an advertising agency. Richard is married to sweet and submissive Charlotte, whom he treats harshly. Victoire, Bertrand’s wife is less than impressed by this display of chauvinism. Both couple decide to experiment with temporary separation. The men setup camp at the office and the women share a house.

Credits: Producers, Gerard Beytout, Francis Cosne ; director, Michel Boisrond ; writers, Michel Boisrond, Annette Wademant ; photography, Daniel Gaudry ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Mireille Darc, Daniel Ceccaldi, Marie-Jose Nat, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Jean-Pierre Darras.

results.title: Si J'etais Un Espion... = Breakdown
results.brief_description:
A doctor pays a house call to one of his regular patient suffering from a nervous ailment. He does not find his patient home but encounters a series of strange characters, all very eager to meet the mysterious Mr. Guerin. Before he knows what happens to him, the good doctor his being coerced into finding Guerin for fear of his life.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Bertrand Blier ; writers, Jacques Cousseau, Jean-Pierre Simonot, Philippe Adrien, Bertrand Blier, Antoine Tudal ; photography, Jean-Louis Picavet ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Bruno Cremer, Patricia Scott, Claude Pieplu, Suzanne Flon.

results.title: 4 aventures de Reinette et Mirabelle = 4 adventures of Reinette and Mirabelle
results.brief_description:
A friendship between two teenage girls who share a flat: Reinette, a country girl who wants to become a painter and Mirabelle, a Parisian student. The four ‘adventures’, in the countryside and then in Paris, reveal the girls’ differing reactions to nature, social injustice, money and the subject invariably at the centre of Rohmer’s films, talk itself.

Credits: Producer, Margaret Menegoz ; director, writer, Eric Rohmer ; photography, Sophie Maintigneux ; editor, Maria-Luisa Garcia ; music, Ronan Girre, Jean-Louis Valero.
Cast: Philippe Laudenbach, Marie Riviere, Fabrice Luchini, Joelle Miquel, Jessica Forde.

results.title: Paris Nous Appartient = Paris Is Ours
results.brief_description:
In the heat of August, in the empty city, a troupe of young actors work on a new production of Shakespeare’s ‘Pericles’ (a play which itself focuses on youthful ideals and commitments) without money and against professional advice. Production difficulties cause enthusiasm to crumble, intrigues to proliferate and little by little the group falls apart. They believe themselves to be victims of an unexplained secret conspiracy. This is a film of mood and lyrical romanticism rather than of narrative lucidity. With ‘A Bout de Souffle’, ‘400 Blows’ and ‘Le Beau Serge’, ‘Paris nous appartient’ (made on virtually no budget) is a key film in the first flowering of La Nouvelle Vague.

Credits: Credist: Producer, Roland Nonin ; director, Jacques Rivette ; writers, Jacques Rivette, Jean Gruault ; photography, Charles Bitsch ; music, Philippe Arthuys.
Cast: Betty Schneider, Giani Esposito, Francoise Prevost, Daniel Crohem, Francois Maistre, Jean-Claude Brialy, Claude Chabrol.

results.title: Juliette Ou la Clef des Songes = juliette or the key of dreams
results.brief_description:
Michel, a prisonner, escapes from his cell every night in dreams to be reunited with his beloved Juliette. In his pursuit of Juliette, Michel arrives in a god-forsaken village where all the inhabitants seem to have lost their memory. Continuity between Occupation and postwar cinema, though great, was far from absolute. At the level of film genre, the most notable change was the rapid decline of one of Occupation’s favored subjects: the fantastic. Stories of ghosts, prophetic dreams, devils and demons, love potions, and the like had greatly appealed to French filmmakers and audiences in the spiritual half-light of the occupied country. (…) The last major film of this trend, and of the period’s strong penchant for the fantastic, was Carne’s ‘Juliette ou la cle des songes’, a work which would certainly have a better reception had the director been able to make it when he first wanted to, in 1942. In 1951 it was a terrible anachronism, received with great hostility at the Cannes film festival and closing after a few weeks of mediocre box office returns, despite having Gerard Philipe (by then a big star) in the male lead.” Alan Williams. “Republic of images: a history of French filmmaking”. Harvard University Press, 1992. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1951: Best music for Joseph Kosma.

Credits: Producer, Sacha Gordine ; director, Marcel Carne ; writer, Georges Neveux, Marcel Carne, Jacques Viot ; photography ; Henri Alekan ; music, Joseph Kosma ; art direction, Alexandre Trauner ; stills photographer, Raymond Voinquel.
Cast: Suzanne Cloutier, Gerard Philippe, Gabrielle Fontan, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Yves Robert.

results.title: Black robe
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Robert Lantos, Stephane Reichel, Sue Milliken, Alliance and Samson
results.brief_description: Based on Canadian author Brian Moore’s acclaimed novel, this is the brutal and breathtaking story of two men and their journey deep into the heart of the rugged Canadian wilderness. Struggling to survive, they face the savagery of the native Indians, the perils of their 1,500 mile trek and the hardships of the hostile land. Acclaimed director Bruce Beresford has created an ultimate adventure, a bold and brave story of courageous men journeying into a dangerous land. Stars Lothaire Bluteau and Aden Young.

results.title: Boudu Sauve des Eaux = Boudu Saved from Drowning
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Jean Gehret and Michel Simon
results.brief_description:
Boudu, a rambling tramp, is taken into the middle-class household of a Parisian book seller after being rescued from the Seine. Boudu shows scant regard for bourgeois decorum. The humour is gently satirical and subversive rather than cutting, but is far from the original play’s affirmation of middle-class culture. Renoir’s use of long takes, camera movement, depth of field in loosely framed compositions with the continuous suggestion of a world beyond the frame, was the antithesis of the then developing Hollywood style of tight compositions and reverse angle cutting. Re-made as ‘Down and out in Beverly Hills’ by Paul Mazursky (1986). Further reading: Richard Boston. ‘Boudu saved from drowning’. London: BFI Publishing, 1994.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gehret, Michel Simon ; director, Jean Renoir ; writers, Jean Renoir, Robert Valentin ; photography, Marcel Lucien, George Asselin ; music, Raphael, Johann Strauss ; editor, Marguerite Houlle-Renoir, Suzanne de Troeye ; assistan
Cast: Michel Simon, Charles Granval, Marcelle Haina, Severine Lerczynska, Max Dalban, Jean Gehret, Jean Daste, Jacques Becker, Jane Pierson.

results.title: Dernier Atout = the Last Ace on the Deck
results.creator_credit: Jacques Becker and Andre Halley des Fontaines
results.brief_description:
“As if he wasnt hamstrung enough by a Nazi Occupation looming over his shoulders, the ambitious Jacques Becker, sets his first film, an atmospheric crime saga in South America! Two police academy students are thrown into deep water when they decide to investigate a criminals death - complicating matters is their arch-rival’ s kid-sister who wants to help. Amazingly, the novice Becker is already a maestro and pulls it off.” Reference: The American Cinematheque. Online. http://www.americancinematheque.com/jacquesbecker99.htm

Credits: Producer, Andre H des Fontaines ; director, Jacques Becker ; writers, Maurice Auberge, Pierre Bost, Louis Chavance ; photography, Nicolas Hayer ; music, Jean Alfaro ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Raymond Roulau, Mireille Balin, Pierre Renoir, Georges Rollin, Noel Roquevert.
